intro: Triopterys quadrialata, commonly known as the four-winged triopterys, is a tropical plant belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is native to the humid forests of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often divided into four distinct lobes, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically clustered in umbels. Triopterys quadrialata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
